name: methanethione, (3-ethoxy-4-hydroxyphenyl)-1-piperidinyl-
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-699

name: methanethione, (3-ethoxy-4-hydroxyphenyl)-1-piperidinyl-
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-699
Reason: The base structure for comparison is benzene, which has a melting point of 5.53°C. Methanethione has a sulfur atom double-bonded to a carbon, which can increase intermolecular forces due to polarizability, raising the melting point significantly, estimated at +60°C. The piperidine ring is aliphatic with a nitrogen that can engage in hydrogen bonding, further increasing melting point since it introduces additional intermolecular interactions, estimated at +20°C. The 3-ethoxy group has an ether function, which is slightly polar but less so than alcohols, providing a minor increase due to polarity, estimated at +10°C. The 4-hydroxy group can form intermolecular hydrogen bonds, significantly raising the melting point, estimated at +30°C. However, due to conjugation and overall molecular rigidity leading to better packing in the solid state, these effects might be slightly reduced.
